thread.title: Armstrong State hosts Richmond Hill fitness days
thread.title_full: Armstrong State hosts Richmond Hill fitness days | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: Armstrong State hosts Richmond Hill fitness days
text:
Photos Back | Next Steve Bisson/Savannah Morning News - Students play Perimeter Ball during an event at the Richmond Hill Fitness Days hosted by Armstrong State University. Back | Next Steve Bisson/Savannah Morning News - Richmond Hill third graders play tag with a large ball during games at the Richmond Hill Fitness Days events held at Armstrong State University. Back | Next Steve Bisson/Savannah Morning News - Third graders from Richmond Hill Elementary School navigate the Pirate Obstacle Course during the 13th Annual Richmond Hill Fitness Days. Back | Next Steve Bisson/Savannah Morning News - Armstrong State University senior Hannah Repperg high-fives third grade students as their welcomed to the gym to participate in the 13th Annual Richmond Hill Fitness Days. Back | Next Steve Bisson/Savannah Morning News - Third graders participate in a game of sheet volleyball during the Richmond Hill Fitness Days hosted by Armstrong State University. By Savannah Morning News About 200 students from Richmond Hill Elementary School were on the Armstrong State University campus Thursday for the first of two sessions of the 13th annual Richmond Hill Fitness Days.
Another 200-plus students are expected today at the Armstrong Sports Center, 11935 Abercorn St., as they learn about the importance of physical fitness and enjoy cardio, flexibility, strength, endurance and other activities.
Armstrong State health and physical education majors led various activities, with help from the varsity womenâ€™s softball team.
